newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: CBT Group buys Australian firm for $10 mln.
newsitem.headline: CBT Group buys Australian firm for $10 mln.

text.p: Dublin-based software company CBT Group said on Wednesday it had agreed to acquire Applied Learning Limited (ALA), a distributor of interactive education software in Australia and New Zealand, for around $10 million.
In a statement, CBT said it had agreed to become the owner of all issued ALA shares in exchange for CBT American Depositary Shares worth around $10 million or six million Irish pounds.
"The acquisition is subject to the approval of the Supreme Court of New South Wales, where ALA is based, and a 75 percent vote of ALA shareholders," CBT said.
CBT said the deal included ALA's Tarragon line of training products, which will expand CBT's courseware offerings to include training materials on developing management, sales and leadership skills.
"ALA has extensive experience in the distribution of interactive training software throughout the growing markets in Australia and New Zealand," CBT said.

"By helping us establish a base in the important Pacific Rim market, this acquisition is an important step forward for CBT as we expand the availability of our products and services to customers worldwide," the group added.
